white_pass@origins.name: white_pass
white_pass@origins.desc[0]: A &+Wwhite&n pass, allowing you into the Spaceport, has been carelessly left here!

magical_bass@origins.name: magical_bass
magical_bass@origins.examine:
This bass is worn, wooden, and beautiful, once having been of the highest 
quality.  You can feel that it has strange, magical properties.
magical_bass@origins.desc[0]:
An old, upright bass with mysterious carvings lies here, somehow lost 
by its owner.

milky_potion@origins.name: milky_potion
milky_potion@origins.desc[0]: This potion is a milky, white liquid with a foul odor.

sunblade@origins.name: sunblade
sunblade@origins.examine:
This is a beautifully crafted weapon that shines as brightly as the sun.
The name '&+GBalladar&n' is written on its hilt.
sunblade@origins.desc[0]: Balladar's &+Ysunblade&n is here, lighting up everything.

drumsticks@origins.name: drumsticks
drumsticks@origins.desc[0]: Neil Peart's worn-out drumsticks sit here, waiting to be returned to the owner.

cylinder_1@origins.desc[1]: The outline of a door appears in the northern wall of the cylinder.
cylinder_1@origins.name: cylinder_1
cylinder_1@origins.examine: It seems openable and closeable from this side only.
cylinder_1@origins.desc[0]: There is an open door in the northern wall of the cylinder.

note2@origins.name: note2
note2@origins.examine:
This note says:

  'I had believed that you had dealt with the elves of
   Rivendell sufficiently.  You have not taken care of their
   new-found human hero Jon, however.  You must understand
   that Jon is from my time, and is extremely dangerous.
   Only by terminating these elves back in your time can I
   hope to change the future and the fate of music!  All music
   as we know it evolves from the music of these elves of
   Rivendell!  They must be slain and their music slain with
   them for the Red Star Federation to succeed!  Behind your
   bookshelf, you will find a device which can take you to me
   should the need arise.
          --Father Brown, Head Priest of the Temples of Syrinx'
note2@origins.desc[0]: A neatly written note lies on a table.

waterfall_1@origins.desc[1]: The waterfall's waters run down in a strange pattern.
waterfall_1@origins.name: waterfall_1
waterfall_1@origins.desc[0]: The water seems to have been parted, revealing an exit.

elven_staff@origins.desc[1]: There is a medium-sized staff under many leaves.
elven_staff@origins.name: elven_staff
elven_staff@origins.examine:
It is a slender wooden piece of art.  It has a crystal-faceted top that 
captures light easily and beautifully.
elven_staff@origins.desc[0]: This is an elven staff with a crystalline head.

wisdom@origins.desc[1]: Your mind lies before you, closed.
wisdom@origins.name: wisdom
wisdom@origins.examine: The essence of all wisdom, your mind, rests within your hands.
wisdom@origins.desc[0]: Your mind lies before you, open.

medium_shield@origins.name: medium_shield
medium_shield@origins.desc[0]: A medium shield with old, faded markings lies here.

temple_paper@origins.name: temple_paper
temple_paper@origins.examine:
The paper reads:
 
               'TemplePaper, December 12, A.D. 2112

REBEL LEADER JON KILLED TODAY IN FOREFRONT OF MUSICAL REVOLUTION!
        Here, in Megadon, as well as under the atmospheric domes
of the Outer Planets, we have had peace since the year 2062, when
the surviving planets were banded together under the &+rRed Star&n of
the Solar Federation.  The less fortunate gave us a few new
moons.  Today, this fragile peace comes to an end as Father Brown
and his forces end Jon's life.  
        It was said that Jon uncovered a plot by Brown and the 
priests of the Temples to ally with a being from the past to 
prevent the evolution of music.  This way, the Temples' music 
would remain unchallenged.  Jon's best disciple, Alex Lifeson,
has vowed to avenge Jon's death...'
temple_paper@origins.desc[0]: One Temple Paper floats down in front of you.

disc_1@origins.name: disc_1
disc_1@origins.examine:
This is a large cylinder, of about 2 feet diameter and 8 feet height.  It has 
an open threshold leading into it, raised about 1.5 feet off the ground.
disc_1@origins.desc[0]: A large cylinder with a door raised a foot off the ground stands here.

dates@origins.name: dates
dates@origins.desc[0]: Some fresh dates lie scattered about.

waterfall@origins.desc[1]: The waterfall's waters run down in a strange pattern.
waterfall@origins.name: waterfall
waterfall@origins.desc[0]: The water seems to have been parted, revealing a cavemouth.

bridge2@origins.desc[1]: There is a raised bridge barring you from crossing and going down.
bridge2@origins.name: bridge2
bridge2@origins.examine: It appears that this bridge can be lowered by someone who knows how...
bridge2@origins.desc[0]: The bridge has been lowered, allowing access downwards.

disc@origins.desc[1]: A large, metallic disc sits here.
disc@origins.name: disc
disc@origins.examine:
You see a large metallic disc, of about 2 feet in diameter, which shines with
a lovely silver glow.  It appears that you can move it, with a little bit of 
work.

note1@origins.name: note1
note1@origins.examine:
The note reads:

  'Dear Jon,
     I don't think we can continue on like this much longer.
   The Necromancer has slain nearly the entire village, and
   has destroyed our precious music.  He has powers the likes
   of which even our sorcerers can't emulate.  Where does he
   get such might?  Is it that mysterious place you come from
   as well?  Please, help us!  You are the only hope we have.
                                              --Saurantha'
note1@origins.desc[0]: A note handwritten in flowing Elvish lies on a desk in the far left corner.

wooden_sign@origins.name: wooden_sign
wooden_sign@origins.examine:
The sign reads:

  'Origins Zone, a story of the origins of man and his music,
   written by &+YBalladar the Bard&n in tribute to his art.

   This zone is based in part on the lyrics by Neil Peart,
   percussionist of Rush.

   --Albums referenced:

   Fly By Night        -- Rivendell (based on Tolkien)
   Caress of Steel     -- The River Don, Willowdale,
                          The Necromancer, Bacchus Plateau,
                          The Fountain of Lamneth
   2112                -- Megadon, The Temple of Syrinx,
                          The Waterfall
   A Farewell to Kings -- The Rocinante, constellations,
                          Cygnus X-1
   Hemispheres         -- entire Olympus area and origins
                          concept'
wooden_sign@origins.desc[0]: A large, old wooden sign floats in the air with you.

altar@origins.name: altar
altar@origins.desc[0]: A large altar dominates the view here.

elfblade@origins.name: elfblade
elfblade@origins.desc[0]: A finely crafted sword of ancient elven make lies here.

bridge1@origins.desc[1]: There is a raised bridge barring you from crossing and going up.
bridge1@origins.name: bridge1
bridge1@origins.examine: It appears that this bridge can be lowered by someone who knows how...
bridge1@origins.desc[0]: The bridge has been lowered, allowing access upwards.

key@origins.name: key
key@origins.desc[0]: A small, slender key with elven markings sits here.

fountain@origins.name: fountain
fountain@origins.examine: You are compelled to drink from its inviting &+Cwaters.&n
fountain@origins.desc[0]: The crystal-clear &+Cwaters&n of the fountain possess a halcyon feel.

love@origins.desc[1]: Your heart lies before you, closed.
love@origins.name: love
love@origins.examine: The essence of all love, your heart, rests within your hands.
love@origins.desc[0]: Your heart lies before you, open.

acoustic_guitar@origins.name: acoustic_guitar
acoustic_guitar@origins.examine:
This guitar is made of wood, and is meant to be placed on a stand.
The words 'The Omega Concern' are engraved on it.
acoustic_guitar@origins.desc[0]: A beautiful, ancient, acoustic guitar lies here waiting to be played.

treebark@origins.name: treebark
treebark@origins.desc[0]: A sheet of treebark that can easily accomodate you has been left here.

bookshelf@origins.desc[1]: A bookshelf rests against the wall.
bookshelf@origins.name: bookshelf
bookshelf@origins.desc[0]: A bookshelf appears to have been slid against the wall.

origins47@origins.title: &+BThe Temples of &+CSyrinx&n
origins47@origins.description:
Upon first entering these buildings, the bleakness of the walls, all 
metallic grey, seem monotonous and foreboding.  But upon further and closer 
examination, you see that they pulse with life!!  Electronic signals and lights
of origin unknown convey a deep sense of mystery.  In its own way, the
machinery of these rooms is alive; electronic impulses are its language and
electricity is its oxygen...
        You get the feeling that the Temples and the things within them are
as old as time itself, though nothing within has ever been seen before.  As
you approach the largest of the buildings, you realize that it is probably the
central edifice of the group of Temples here -- a seat for the "town's"
government.  You enter the only room available, which seems to be the largest
as well, and from its atmosphere, the most important.
        Three elaborate thrones dominate the center of the room, raised on a
dias.  On the lowest step of the dias is written "&+GElder Race&n".  On each of
the three thrones is a single word, beautifully rendered in flowing script. The
left throne says "&+rRed Star&n", the right one "&+RSolar Federation&n" and the 
central throne reads "&+CSYRINX&n".  There are a myriad of computers, monitors, 
and sound equipment all over the room, all in perfect order.  On the floor in 
the very center, right below the dias, is a pentagram inscribed within a 
circle, all in red.  The topmost point of the pentagram points directly to the 
central throne.

origins40@origins.title: The Necromancer's Room
origins40@origins.description:
You enter a small chamber, filled to the brim with test tubes, 
distillation tubes, decanters, flasks, and various other equipment an evil, 
dark mage would have.  Numerous volumes of the "Arcanum Magicana Disciplina," 
penned by the greatest Dark Mage, the legendary &+LSuraklin&n himself, rest on 
the bookshelf.  You stare in abject horror; how could one live for so long in 
such a small room, with so little remaining space? But the answer to that is 
painfully obvious: the Necromancer stopped 'living' in days long since past...

origins46@origins.title: Small Room
origins46@origins.description:
You climb down the small steps, into an even smaller room.  However, 
this room is carpeted, well-furnished, and very pleasant smelling.

origins31@origins.title: Inside the Castle
origins31@origins.description:
You continue southward, undaunted by the fear which grips your skin 
and chills you to the bone.  This room is a simple, square affair, void of 
items or furniture, with exits to the south and west.  Optionally, you can 
exit the castle to the north of here.

origins43@origins.title: The Only House in Sight
origins43@origins.description:
You come upon a small, metallic, domed shelter, that appears as bleak 
as the entire area you are in.  There is no concept of a 'yard' here, it would 
seem.  However, though you cannot find any place to enter the house, you do 
hear the actual sounds of running water to your north!  It is also possible to
return east to Megadon.

origins34@origins.title: Base of the Tower
origins34@origins.description:
You arrive at the base of one of the great towers which dominate the 
castle's exterior.  The walls of the tower are covered with moss and and 
decay, and a vile stench pervades the air.
        You may climb the stairs to the top or return to the courtyard.

origins29@origins.title: The Lands of the Necromancer
origins29@origins.description:
As grey traces of dawn tinge the eastern sky, you emerge from the 
forest shadow, ford the River Don, and leave the trodden town of Willowdale.
        You turn south, journeying into the dark and forbidding lands of the 
Necromancer.  Even now, the intensity of his dread power can be felt, 
weakening the body and saddening the heart.
        You reflect upon the empty, mindless spectres, stripped of will and 
soul.  Only your thirst to aid the elves of Rivendell gives you hunger for 
vengeance...

origins49@origins.title: The Spaceport
origins49@origins.description:
You enter the heart of the great Spaceport, and come face to face with 
the large flying objects, which you overhear the people refer to as 
'spaceships'.  Many people embark and disembark from these ships before your 
eyes.
        Most of the ships are huge, but one particularly small one dubbed 
"The Rocinante" catches your eye.  There is a man at that ship, who gestures 
for you to go see him.  It would also be possible for you to head back up 
north toward Megadon.

origins41@origins.title: Megadon
origins41@origins.description:
You lie awake, staring out at the bleakness of Megadon.  City and sky 
become one, a vast sea of unbroken grey.  The Twin Moons, just two pale orbs 
as they trace their way across the sky.  You see various people 'plugging' 
into their machines, and carrying Temple Papers.
        From here, you may choose to walk in any direction.  To the north lie
clearly the most important buildings here; huge, metallic structures which form
a small town of their own and easily dominates the view for miles.  To the
south lies the spaceport, where large vehicles capable of flight arrive and
depart regularly.  To the east is another large edifice, and people are
bustling in and out of there hurriedly.  Finally, to the west, is the single
place of residence you can recognize.  It reminds you of familiar houses at
home, except that it is made of metal.

origins56@origins.title: The Heart of Cygnus
origins56@origins.description:
...headlong into mystery!  The x-ray is her siren song, your ship 
cannot resist her long, nearer to your deadly goal, until...

origins2@origins.title: Into Rivendell
origins2@origins.description:
You walk deeper into the great forest, and your awe at the natural 
splendor only increases.  It is obvious by now that sentient beings 
definitely guard and cherish these woods.
        The path continues in all directions from here.

origins35@origins.title: Base of the Tower
origins35@origins.description:
You arrive at the base of one of the great towers which dominate the 
castle's exterior.  The walls of the tower are covered with moss and and 
decay, and a vile stench pervades the air.
        You may climb the stairs to the top or return to the courtyard.

origins60@origins.title: The City of Immortals
origins60@origins.description:
After many an hour of tiresome marching, you come upon a large, 
beautiful city.  The road is indeed marble white, and the buildings are purest 
gold.  The mountain is closer than ever now, and its peak is hidden in wispy, 
fluffy, white clouds.
        But what distracts your attention from all this beauty is the scores 
upon scores of dead bodies of all races, which line the road and the rest of 
the City.
        You may now turn left, to an area of the City marked as 'Apollo's 
Hemisphere', turn right to another division marked 'Dionysus's Hemisphere,' 
or continue north to the base of the great mountain.

origins13@origins.title: Elven Temple
origins13@origins.description:
You enter the primary worship center of the Rivendell elves.  In 
contrast to the rest of the city, this place is peaceful and submissive.  It 
is not in disarray.  A single exit leads east back into the city.

origins36@origins.title: Top of the Tower
origins36@origins.description:
You climb the stairs to the top of the tower.  From this vantage, you 
can see the courtyard below, and most of the lands that the castle overlooks 
outdoors.  The one option is to return down the stairs.

origins8@origins.title: Lost in the Forest
origins8@origins.description:
You are lost among the giant firs, redwoods, and elms that surround 
you on all fronts.  You can go in any direction.

origins39@origins.title: The Top of the Stairs
origins39@origins.description:
You climb the long flight of steps, heading toward the zenith, and the 
climb is a long and tedious one.  The stairs squeak loudly as you tread upon 
them.  You pray that the fragile stairs don't crumble underneath your feet.  
As you reach the top, you see a door.  Optionally, you may head back down the 
stairs.

origins59@origins.title: Wide Marble Road
origins59@origins.description:
You wake up, your bones feeling like jelly and your heart beating a 
mile a minute.  You look around for your brave captain Neil Peart, but he is 
nowhere to be found...
        The road you stand on is very wide, and directly ahead of you, yet 
miles away still, is a very, very large mountain.  You can follow this road 
north only, but for many miles.

origins28@origins.title: Bacchus Plateau
origins28@origins.description:
After what feels like hours of climbing, you break through the foul 
mist.  Sunlight beams down upon you, then continues down to be swallowed by 
the mist. From this vantage, you could have seen everything, were it not for 
that mist, which functions as a jealous blanket for the ground below.
        Here, however, it seems that the parasitic power of the Necromancer 
has no effect...

origins27@origins.title: Uuuuh, uh-oh...
origins27@origins.description:
The mist here is thicker and seems to be choking the very life out of 
you!

origins7@origins.title: Lost in the Forest
origins7@origins.description:
You are lost among the giant firs, redwoods, and elms that surround 
you on all fronts.  You can go in any direction.

origins18@origins.title: The Road to Willowdale
origins18@origins.description:
Fighting back to consciousness, coldness grips your skin.  It suddenly 
becomes obvious to you that Panacea and Geddy Lee have sent you here for a 
reason.  All around you, trees hang somberly about you, much resembling the 
willowy trees of swamps.  You can't help but feel that the trees are watching 
your every move, with misshapen and contorted faces of agony.
        The road leads on into darkness to the north.

origins54@origins.title: Constellation Deneb
origins54@origins.description: ...Flew into the light of Deneb, sailed across the Milky Way...

origins24@origins.title: Lands Stripped Bare
origins24@origins.description:
This area east of Willowdale must once have been where the inhabitants 
of the city did their farming.  But now, the once rich and fertile earth has 
been violently stripped of all semblance of fertility.  It reminds you of 
deliberately washing salt into soil to make it infertile, only this is far 
worse.
        In front of you is a small mountain which appears to have some 
greenery growing on it, and doesn't appear difficult to climb.  You may 
retreat back west to Willowdale, or climb the small mountain.
        The very life essence of the area is gone, leaving a cold, hard, empty 
shell.  Clothes may warm the body, but they do not warm the soul...

origins61@origins.title: Dionysus's Hemisphere
origins61@origins.description:
You enter a large, forested area of the City, where naked beings of 
all races frolick about, care-free and worry-free.  Many dead bodies lay 
about, among them both naked ones and well-equipped ones.  The naked dead ones 
appear to have fallen victim to starvation, cold, and wolves, while a few 
have apparently been killed by weapons from the well-equipped beings.  The 
well-equipped bodies have obviously been slain by primitive tools and weapons.
        A single path leads west back to the City.

origins10@origins.title: Rivendell City Gates
origins10@origins.description:
You come to the gates of the beautiful Elven city of Rivendell.  They 
are carved lovingly out of the wood that surrounds everything here.  Through 
them, you can see the fabled elven town.  You doubt you've ever seen anything 
this magnificent before.
        The road leading north into the city has, however, fallen into severe 
disrepair.

origins58@origins.title: The Bridge of Death
origins58@origins.description:
You feel as if your very life force has been torn from your body.

&+B-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

&+C                  ...Death grips you painfully...

&+B-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-
Connection closed by...wait!

You have memory, and awareness,
But you have no shape or form;
As a disembodied spirit,
You are dead, and yet unborn...

You have passed into Olympus,
As was told in tales of old;
To the City of Immortals,
Marble &+wwhite,&n and purest &+Ygold...&n

origins4@origins.title: Lost in the Forest
origins4@origins.description:
You are lost among the giant firs, redwoods, and elms that surround 
you on all fronts.  You can go in any direction.

origins55@origins.title: Across the Milky Way
origins55@origins.description:
...On your ship, the Rocinante, spinning through the galaxies.  
Headed for...

origins64@origins.title: Inside Olympus
origins64@origins.description:
You walk forward, entering the huge mountain.  It is but a small, 
hollowed-out area within the mountain, designed for the purpose of holding a 
beast.

origins26@origins.title: The Veil of Mist
origins26@origins.description: The mist surrounds you on all sides.

origins57@origins.title: The Black Hole Gains Control!
origins57@origins.description:
Spinning, whirling, still descending, like a spiral sea unending!  
Sound and fury drown your heart, 
     EVERY NERVE IS TORN APART!!!!.........................................

origins16@origins.title: The Mountain in the East
origins16@origins.description:
The light from the staff increases in magnitude until all you can see 
is a blinding white light and all you can hear in your head are the words 
'Draw towards the fountain'.
        But soon the sound dies down and the light gives way to a most 
soothing and pastoral scene.  You stand high atop a mountain, overlooking a 
vast ocean to the west and a beautiful sylvan forest in all other directions.  
The sheer natural beauty of this place, so pure and relaxing it is, has you 
in a total state of relaxation.  From here, you can see the whole world it 
seems, and you feel invincible, almost immortal...
        Above you and slightly to the east, you hear the sounds of running 
water, and a mysterious, sultry voice beckons to you.  "Come up," the voice 
soothes.

origins22@origins.title: Willowdale
origins22@origins.description:
You reach the stricken village of Willowdale, and right away wish you 
hadn't.  Cries of anguish from stricken mothers and children pervade the heavy 
gloom.  Depression falls heavier than a thick mantle here.
        There is not much to see, as all the homes and buildings have been 
shattered.  The dreary path turns south towards a large castle, north into 
hellish woods, east towards dead land, or offers passage to the west back 
across the river.

origins12@origins.title: An Elven Dwelling
origins12@origins.description:
You enter a modestly furnished elven home.  There are signs of a 
recent battle here.  Furniture lies scattered about, and more destroyed 
musical instruments can be found.

origins42@origins.title: TempleVision
origins42@origins.description:
Upon entering this room, you feel like you are going to faint, due to 
the plethora of bright lights and noise.  The source of most of the light is 
row upon row upon row of large screens, to which many people are attached.  
The images seem quite amorphous to you, but the people using them probably see
a whole new world...
        A single western exit heads back out to Megadon.

origins19@origins.title: Narrowing Road
origins19@origins.description:
The twisted road becomes more and more narrow here, and moving is 
increasingly difficult.  The air is thicker still, and the comforting rays of 
the sun are not to be found.
        To the south is a slightly more comforting environment, and you dread 
to walk further north, into the empty dreariness.

origins62@origins.title: Apollo's Hemisphere
origins62@origins.description:
This area of the city is bare of all trees.  On the contrary, the 
edifices here are well-built and offer excellent shelter.  Many dead bodies 
lay about, among them both naked ones and well-equipped ones.  The naked ones 
have apparently been killed by weapons from the well-equipped beings.  
The well-equipped bodies have obviously been slain by primitive tools and 
weapons.  There is but a single living being here.
        A lonely, blood-stricken road leads east into the City.

origins37@origins.title: Top of the Tower
origins37@origins.description:
You climb the stairs to the top of the tower.  From this vantage, you 
can see the courtyard below, and most of the lands that the castle overlooks 
outdoors.  The one option is to return down the stairs.

origins65@origins.title: Mount Olympus
origins65@origins.description:
You have arrived at the home of the Gods themselves.  Here is the 
place where the Immortals live, untouched by the petty, trivial grievances of 
mere mortals.  You can see the whole world from this awesome vantage. You are 
indeed invincible here.  All that you could ever hope for can be found, and 
even then there is some left over...
        You look down from Olympus on a world of doubt and fear.  Its surface 
is splintered into sorry hemispheres.  But suddenly, the very elven music you 
helped save issues forth from your love and wisdom.  The chaos below ceases, 
and the people stop fighting, somehow awestruck by its beauty.  
        Apollo and Dionysus turn to you and say '&+WWe shall call you Cygnus, 
&+gthe Bringer of &+GBalance!&+W  We now see that only through a balance of both Truth 
&+Wand Love can the miracle of life succeed.  And this beautiful music is its 
&+Wbackbone...  Now, dear Bringer of Balance, if you wish to leave us, simply 
&+Wcast away your fears and jump.&n'

origins33@origins.title: Castle Courtyard
origins33@origins.description:
You enter a large, open, square area, obviously the courtyard of the 
castle.  The usual plant life that dominates the courtyards of most castles is 
not to be found here.  A flight of stairs lies to the south, while towers lie 
to the east and west.

origins30@origins.title: Entrance to the Castle
origins30@origins.description:
You reach the main gates of the castle.  Looking up, you see the tops 
of the towers reach high into the mist, like black spires twisting their way 
through your flesh.  The gates themselves seem deadly -- totally blackened and 
misshapen.
        You can continue on through the open threshold (there might have once 
been a door here), or you can wisely return north towards Willowdale.

origins25@origins.title: Small Mountain
origins25@origins.description:
You climb until you reach a thick veil of mist.  You can try to brave 
the mist or head back down.

origins20@origins.title: Nightmare Road
origins20@origins.description:
The road you have been following ends abruptly here, but you might be 
able to ford a river to your east.  You can also retrace the road back south.
        You feel as if you are walking right into the heart of something 
extremely evil.  You can't help but get that feeling of being watched.

origins67@origins.title: Inside the Cylinder
origins67@origins.description:
You step into the giant cylinder, which is just as metallic and plain
here on the inside as it appeared on the outside.  The glow here persists, but
strangely enough, it doesn't provide any illumination.

origins38@origins.title: The Foot of the Stairs
origins38@origins.description:
You exit the courtyard and reach the foot of a long flight of steps 
that seems to reach up forever.  You seem to perceive some movement at the top 
of the stairs, but cannot from this distance ascertain exactly what it is.
        You may climb the steps or return north to the courtyard.

origins14@origins.title: The Center of the City
origins14@origins.description:
You are standing directly beneath the beautiful arch.  The sunlight 
shines down directly upon you, granting a soothing, relaxing feeling.
        Due north, you see that a great black chasm has ripped the earth 
apart from the westernmost position of the city to its easternmost.  It 
appears to be very deep and dangerous to negotiate.

origins48@origins.title: Entrance to the Spaceport
origins48@origins.description:
You come to a large compound, almost as large as the Temple of Syrinx, 
filled with large objects that fly without effort.  You have never seen such 
wonder.  You are still too far outside the Spaceport to see any more detail.
        You may return north to Megadon or enter the Spaceport to the south.

origins66@origins.title: A Farewell to Things
origins66@origins.description:
You jump off of the zenith, and suddenly find yourself floating down 
gently in midair.  You lose all sense of time or place, and enjoy the most 
wonderful feeling you have ever experienced.
        As you feather-fall down to the Temple of Paradise, you see three 
faces in front of you.  To the left is the stern and solid face of Apollo, 
Bringer of Wisdom.  To the right is the beautiful and kind visage of the 
Bringer of Love, Dionysus.  And in the center is Cygnus, God of Balance.  
They all sing beautifully in unison to you:

"&+WWe can walk our road together
 &+WIf our goals are all the same
 &+WWe can run alone and free
 &+WIf we pursue a different aim;
 &+WLet the truth of Love be lighted
 &+WLet the love of Truth shine clear
 &+WSensibilty
 &+WArmed with sense and liberty
 &+WWith the Heart and Mind united
 &+WIn a single, perfect Sphere...&n"

origins21@origins.title: The River Don
origins21@origins.description:
You have reached the great River Don, the outermost boundary of the 
lands of the Necromancer.  It appears impassable, save for a bridge that does
not appear to be in very good condition.
        You may retreat back west or ford the river to the east.

origins32@origins.title: Castle Kitchens
origins32@origins.description:
This large room was once the kitchen for the entire castle.  But due 
to the current horrific, undead state of its inhabitants, this room has fallen 
into neglect.
        There doesn't appear to be anything here but old kitchenware.  The 
single exit is back east.

origins11@origins.title: The City of Rivendell
origins11@origins.description:
The marvel of this city's architecture only increases as your eyes 
get closer to it.  The homes all about you are shaped, not built from the 
wood of the trees, and are thus part of them.  Sunlight is captured 
beautifully by a crystal arch spanning the entire city from your left to 
right, and it is focused miraculously into one spot in the center of the city.
        All around you are numerous elven dwellings.  Yet the city seems 
oddly quiet for so large an area, and so merry a people...
        You see numerous destroyed musical instruments littering the streets; 
lyres with broken strings, recorders and flutes with shattered bodies, and 
drums with broken heads.  There is a door to your right, leading to a large 
elven home, and a large threshold to your left.  The city continues on to the 
north.

origins1@origins.title: The Entrance to Rivendell
origins1@origins.description:
You stand at the beginning of a fantastic forest,  whose very trees 
seem to be as old as the earth they grow from.  Despite the density of the 
foliage, the sunlight shines through nearly unobstructed.  The majesty of 
these trees gives you a sense of smallness...
        A well-worn path leads north into the forest.

origins50@origins.title: Inside the Rocinante
origins50@origins.description:
You follow the man, and climb up into the ship.  Before your eyes are 
huge panels on all four walls, filled with buttons and lights you don't 
understand.
        The entire interior of the ship humms slightly, and you can feel these 
subtle vibrations.  They tickle you.
        The man seems to understand your need to get home.  You have one last 
chance to go back down, or you may press forward and follow his lead.

origins17@origins.title: &+bThe &+BFountain &+bof &+RLamneth&n
origins17@origins.description:
You follow the voice and come to a beautiful waterfall, which cascades 
gently down the sides of the mountain.  The waterfall feeds a large, round 
fountain, made of stone forged out of the very bowels of the mountain itself.  
The water in the fountain is perfectly crystal clear, and seems to glow white.
        The view here is even more spectacular than the one before, with the 
fountain and waterfall only enhancing its marvel.  You want to stay here 
forever...

origins51@origins.title: Takeoff!
origins51@origins.description:
The ship starts to move slightly, and the slight hum you heard 
increases in intensity to nearly intolerable levels!  The ship suddenly 
lurches upward, and you feel like you are going to be sick.  Your ears pop, 
your vision blurrs, and you feel faint.  But you know that there is no turning 
back now.
        As soon as the dome of the planet is cleared, you begin to feel 
accustomed to the travel.  Through the windows, you can see the very stars you 
saw at night back home.
        Meanwhile, brave Neil Peart tells you a story:
"&+WIn the constellation of Cygnus, there lurks a mysterious,
 &+Winvisible force; the Black Hole of Cygnus X-1.  Six stars of the
 &+WNorthern Cross, in mourning for their sister's loss, in a final
 &+Wflash of glory, nevermore to grace the night...&n"

origins52@origins.title: Constellation Lyra
origins52@origins.description: You set a course just east of Lyra...

origins23@origins.title: The Forest Shadow
origins23@origins.description:
You enter perhaps the most tortured and vile woods you ever seen.  You 
can see the trees literally weeping blood, and not even one bird can be found.
        The forest gets too thick to negotiate any further.  Your one option 
is to return south whence you came.

origins63@origins.title: Base of Olympus
origins63@origins.description:
You now stand at the base of the incredible mountain, and you realize 
that a mere mortal like yourself could never effect such a climb without
special aid.  You can instead head north into the mountain, or back south the 
way you came.

origins5@origins.title: Lost in the Forest
origins5@origins.description:
You are lost among the giant firs, redwoods, and elms that surround 
you on all fronts.  You can go in any direction.

origins15@origins.title: Inside the Chasm
origins15@origins.description:
You enter the rough chasm and instantly lose your footing.  As you 
fall, you wonder whether you will die by impact or by impalement on the sharp 
rocks...

origins6@origins.title: Lost in the Forest
origins6@origins.description:
You are lost among the giant firs, redwoods, and elms that surround 
you on all fronts.  You can go in any direction.

origins44@origins.title: The Waterfall
origins44@origins.description:
Lo and behold!  Despite the total lack of organic material in all of 
Megadon, you have arrived at a beautiful waterfall, which gently cascades down 
the side of a tiny stone mountain into a small reservoir built for the purpose 
of holding the precious water.
        The road leads back south towards the house.

origins3@origins.title: Lost in the Forest
origins3@origins.description:
You are lost among the giant firs, redwoods, and elms that surround 
you on all fronts.  You can go in any direction.

origins9@origins.title: Lost in the Forest
origins9@origins.description:
You are lost among the giant firs, redwoods, and elms that surround 
you on all fronts.  You can go in any direction.

origins45@origins.title: The Cave
origins45@origins.description:
You walk underneath the waterfall and enter a small cave.  The 
interior of the cave contains a bed, a table, and other small living 
essentials.  It is otherwise void of anything else.  The walls here are actual 
stone, not metal.
        The cave's exit is to the south, and at the far corner of the 
interior, you spot a flight of steps.

lee@origins.name: Lee
lee@origins.description:
Geddy Lee, keeper of the magical Bridge of Lamneth, stands here looking worried.
&+WGeddy Lee&n asks you '&+WHave you seen my &+Wmagical bass?&n'

sothurithidan@origins.name: Sothurithidan
sothurithidan@origins.description: The sword guard of Rivendell, Sothurithidan, will allow no passage!

imbalance@origins.name: Imbalance
imbalance@origins.description:
The bestial personification of imbalance, bane of all orderly and productive 
life, threatens you mockingly.

spectre@origins.name: Spectre
spectre@origins.description:
A wispy, shadowy, form guards the location of its death fiercely!
'&+WStay back or die,&n' the weary shade of the Traveler moans.  Its very voice
drains the courage out of you.

broonsie@origins.name: Broonsie
broonsie@origins.description: T.C. Broonsie asks for your spaceport pass.

numbskull@origins.name: Numbskull
numbskull@origins.description: Numbskull the mindless skeleton guard doesn't like intruders!

apollo@origins.name: Apollo
apollo@origins.description:
&+WApollo, &+gBringer of &+BWisdom,&n says '&+WI bring Truth and Understanding, 
&+WI bring Wit and Wisdom fair; precious gifts beyond compare.&n'

addict@origins.name: Addict
addict@origins.description: One guy has had a little too much TempleVision for one day!

koshee@origins.name: Koshee
koshee@origins.description: Koshee, the fabled elven dog, guards his woods zealously.

lifeson@origins.name: Lifeson
lifeson@origins.description:
&+WAlex Lifeson &nsays '&+WMy mentor Jon has been &+Wmurdered!  &+WLet's  discuss this
&+Wgrave issue.&n'

necromancer@origins.name: Necromancer
necromancer@origins.description: Suddenly, a human-shaped wraith materializes in front of you!

cooshee@origins.name: Cooshee
cooshee@origins.description: Cooshee, legendary dog of the elves, defends Rivendell with his brother Koshee.

skeletree@origins.name: Skeletree
skeletree@origins.description: A skeletal tree weeping blood sits rooted miserably to the ground here.

dumbskull@origins.name: Dumbskull
dumbskull@origins.description: The skeletal guard Dumbskull wants you off his post!

panacea@origins.name: Panacea
panacea@origins.description:
Panacea, liquid grace and passion pure, seductively beckons you.
&+WPanacea &nwhispers '&+WI will soothe your primal fears...&n'

cathshee@origins.name: Cathshee
cathshee@origins.description: The mythical elven cat, Cath-shee, protects her sacred forest unto death.

dionysus@origins.name: Dionysus
dionysus@origins.description:
&+WDionysus, &+gBringer of &+RLove,&n says '&+WI bring Love to give you solace, 
&+Win the Darkness of the Night; only Love can steer you right.&n'

peart@origins.name: Peart
peart@origins.description:
Neil Peart, the 'professor' of percussion, wields his drumsticks expertly.
&+WNeil Peart &nsays '&+WI can take you home, on my &+Wship.&n'

snowdog@origins.name: Snowdog
snowdog@origins.description:
SnowDog, centurion of evil, nemesis of ByTor, and guardian of The Necromancer,
attacks!

specter@origins.name: Specter
specter@origins.description: The slain body of the hero ByTor has been animated!

brown@origins.name: Brown
brown@origins.description: Father Brown, Head Priest of the Temples of Syrinx, smiles warmly at you.
